title: SocialConnect Settles Class Action Over Facial Recognition Misuse
author: Lisa Chen

content.intro: Social media giant SocialConnect has agreed to a $7 million settlement after unlawfully collecting and storing biometric data without user permission.

sections.title: What Was the Issue?
sections.content: The company used facial recognition technology to tag users in photos without their consent, violating Illinoisâ€™ Biometric Privacy Act.

sections.title: Who Is Eligible?
sections.content: Illinois residents who used SocialConnect between **2018-2024** can file a claim for an estimated $200-$400 each.

sections.title: Policy Changes
sections.content: SocialConnect must delete all unlawfully collected biometric data and introduce stricter privacy controls.
